definition: To blur or smudge something, typically used to describe the action of making a clear image or text less distinct or sharp. It is often employed when referring to the act of erasing or obscuring details, either physically or metaphorically.

examples.german: Die Farben verwischen auf der Leinwand.
examples.english: The colors blur on the canvas.
The rain washes away the tracks.

examples.german: Die Tinte ist verwischt und unleserlich.
examples.english: The ink is smudged and illegible.

examples.german: Die Grenzen zwischen den Genres verwischen immer mehr.
examples.english: The boundaries between genres are becoming increasingly blurred.

examples.german: Die Erinnerungen an die Vergangenheit verwischen mit der Zeit.
examples.english: Memories of the past fade with time.
